column4: anyone here who can help a newbie :)? i am trying to increase my hz from 60 to 85 and now i am in the terminal but i dont know how to save my changes in the xorg.conf. in a tutorial they say "press enter" but then i just get a new line
are you using vi or nano
for vi you press esc then shift : then wq easiler to do nano then its ctrl+x
you need to push : key and wq to write and quit
do sudo nano /path/to/file then youy can save with ctrl+x
nano is a much easier edit to use
wq stands for write file and quit
ok push esc then shift + : key
any tutorial you follow just replace vi with nano then at bottom of screen it tells you how to save exit etc
this can be done by pushing ctrl+alt+backspace
your hz is dependant on the resolution depending on the driver used for video
on my nvidia system I can have 1260xblah at 60hz and then 1152x Blah at 75Hz it also depends on monitor
